00010 typedef int (*entry_point) (int argc, void* argv);

00012 unsigned char mapMemoryUsingHeader(e32_pheader program_header)
00013 {
00014 
00015         //If the program header is a loadable object, map it into memory
00016         if (program_header.p_type == PT_LOAD)
00017         {
00018 
00019                 MEM_LOC v_addr_start = program_header.p_vaddr;
00020                 MEM_LOC v_addr_end = v_addr_start + program_header.p_memsz;
00021 
00022                 DEBUG_PRINT("Mapping header between 0x%x and 0x%x\n", v_addr_start, v_addr_end);
00023 
00024                 MEM_LOC iterator = v_addr_start;
00025                         
00026                 while (iterator < v_addr_end)
00027                 {
00028                         map(iterator, allocateFrame(), PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_WRITE | PAGE_USER);
00029                         iterator += PAGE_SIZE;
00030                 }
00031         } else
00032         {
00033         }
00034 
00035         return 1;
00036 }
00037 
00038 unsigned char loadToMemoryUsingHeader(e32_pheader program_header, fs_node_t* Node)
00039 {
00040         //If the program header is a loadable object, map it into memory
00041         if (program_header.p_type == PT_LOAD)
00042         {
00043                 if (read_fs(Node, program_header.p_offset, program_header.p_filesz, program_header.p_vaddr) != program_header.p_filesz)
00044                 {
00045                         DEBUG_PRINT("Error bad read\n");
00046                         return 0;
00047                 }
00048         }
00049 
00050         return 1;
00051 }
00052 
00053 //NOTE: This function relies on Node being readable (read_fs functioning properly)
00054 int loadAndExecuteElf(fs_node_t* Node, unsigned char usermode)
00055 {
00056         DEBUG_PRINT("Loading program\n");
00057 
00058         //Read the ELF info
00059         e32info* fileInfo = malloc(sizeof(e32info));
00060         memset(fileInfo, 0, sizeof(e32info));
00061 
00062         parseElfFile(fileInfo, Node);
00063 
00064         DEBUG_PRINT("Parsed ELF file\n");
00065 
00066         //Use the header from the parsed file
00067         e32_header head = fileInfo->m_mainHeader;
00068 
00069         //Is it a executable?
00070         if (head.e_type != ELF_EXE)
00071         {
00072                 return LOAD_ERROR_NOT_EXE;
00073         }
00074 
00075         //Valid header?
00076         if (elfHeaderValid(head) != 1)
00077         {
00078                 return LOAD_ERROR_BAD_HEAD;
00079         }
00080 
00081         //32bit executable?
00082         if (getElfHeaderClass(head) != ELF_CLASS_32)
00083         {
00084                 return LOAD_ERROR_BAD_PLATFORM;
00085         }
00086 
00087         //Version correct?
00088         if (getElfHeaderVersion(head) != ELF_VERSION_CURRENT)
00089         {
00090                 return LOAD_ERROR_BAD_HEAD;
00091         }
00092 
00093         //ELF_DATA_LSB + ELF_CLASS_32 = IA32 = 8086 compatable
00094         if (getElfHeaderData(head) != ELF_DATA_LSB)
00095         {
00096                 return LOAD_ERROR_BAD_PLATFORM;
00097         }
00098 
00099         DEBUG_PRINT("Mapping program headers\n");
00100 
00101         //This segment of code correlates to the loading of the data into virtual memory
00102 
00103         //Iterate through every program header
00104         unsigned int header_iter = 0;
00105         for (header_iter = 0; header_iter < fileInfo->m_numProgramHeaders; header_iter++)
00106         {
00107 
00108                 e32_pheader program_header = fileInfo->m_programHeaders[header_iter];
00109                 
00110                 if (mapMemoryUsingHeader(program_header) != 1)
00111                 {
00112                         DEBUG_PRINT("Error mapping program header %i\n", header_iter);
00113                         return LOAD_ERROR_BAD_MAP;
00114                 }
00115 
00116         }
00117 
00118         DEBUG_PRINT("Copying program headers\n");
00119 
00120         //Load the object blocks that where just mapped
00121         for (header_iter = 0; header_iter < fileInfo->m_numProgramHeaders; header_iter++)
00122         {
00123 
00124                 e32_pheader program_header = fileInfo->m_programHeaders[header_iter];
00125                 if (loadToMemoryUsingHeader(program_header, Node) != 1)
00126                 {
00127                         DEBUG_PRINT("Error unable to load header %i\n", header_iter);
00128                         return LOAD_ERROR_BAD_LOAD;
00129                 }
00130 
00131         }
00132 
00133         DEBUG_PRINT("Entering program\n");
00134         //This segment of code correlates to its execution
00135         entry_point program_entry_ponter = head.e_entry;
00136 
00137         //This free's up the ELF info and then deletes the structure from the heap
00138         freeElfFileInfo(fileInfo);
00139         free(fileInfo);
00140 
00141         if (usermode == 1)
00142         {
00143                 switchToUserMode();
00144         }
00145 
00146         program_entry_ponter(0, 0);
00147 
00148         return; //Should never really get here
00149 }
